intro: Cucubalus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flower bignay, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The fruit is a small, round drupe that turns red when mature, containing a single seed.
